DOC.brief_summary: To determine effectiveness human dehydrate umbilical cord allograft standard open rotator cuff repair assess American Shoulder Elbow Surgeons ( ASES ) score 12 month post-op .
DOC.brief_title: Use Human Dehydrated Umbilical Cord Allograft Supraspinatus Tendon Repair
DOC.criteria: 1 . MRI confirm diagnosis full thickness supraspinatus tendon tear necessitate surgical intervention ( rotator cuff repair ) 2 . Subject male female age 18 old 3 . Subject willing able provide inform consent participate procedure followup evaluation necessary complete study Subjects meet ANY follow criterion exclude study : 1 . Shoulder pain primarily attribute follow : 1 . Ligament rupture due use fluoroquinolones 2 . Capsular tear 3 . Fracture humeral head 4 . Inflammation joint surround tissue ( i.e . osteoarthritis , bursitis ) 5 . Neuropathic , radiate pain condition result damage inflammation nerve 6 . Previous history autoimmune connective tissue disorder ( i.e . rheumatoid arthritis , systemic lupus erythematosus ) 2 . Known history poor compliance medical treatment 3 . Subject bilateral supraspinatus tendon tear 4 . Subject sign symptom active infection shoulder joint 5 . Retraction supraspinatus tendon exceed 1.5 cm length 6 . Subject additional injury require surgical intervention ipsilateral arm 7 . Subject previous surgery target arm within past 6 month prior treatment plan surgery Rotator Cuff Repair target arm within 180 day treatment 8 . Subjects currently receive radiation therapy chemotherapy 9 . Subjects use investigational drug , device biologic within 12 week prior treatment 10 . Subjects pregnant enrollment plan become pregnant within 180 day treatment 11 . Subject significant medical condition ( ) , opinion Investigator , would interfere protocol evaluation participation 12 . Allergy known sensitivity aminoglycoside antibiotic gentamicin sulfate and/or streptomycin sulfate 13 . Workers ' compensation patient
